Home » News » Boko Haram: 2.5m children suffering from starvation – Borno Lawmakers Boko Haram: 2.5m children suffering from starvation – Borno Lawmakers On 5:03 am In News by Tony Comments 
By Henry Umoru 
THIRTEEN lawmakers from Borno State in the National Assembly comprising the Senators and members of House of Representatives yesterday said the Federal Government was not doing enough to solve the humanitarian crisis in Borno, Adamawa, and Yobe states. 
The lawmakers said the number of children facing acute hunger and starvation had risen to 2.5 million. 
Addressing Journalists yesterday in Abuja, Chairman of the state caucus in the National Assembly and immediate-past Senate Leader, Ali Ndume said that in the 2016 budget, only N12 Billion was allocated to the Presidential Initiative on North East (PINE). 
He said only 75 percent was released. 
Ndume said: “In the budget proposal under consideration by the National Assembly, only N45 billion was allocated to PINE. This is grossly inadequate to address the emergency humanitarian crisis we are faced with. 
“Except a few Individuals particularly Gen. T. Y Danjuma ,retd, and Aliko Dangote, some organizations and NGOs, Nigerians are just watching us going through this horrific experience in our life time.’’ 
“About 14.8 million people are affected by the crisis. The estimated cost of destructions is put at over $9 billion. Up to 7.0 million people in the North East are in need of humanitarian assistance and 1.8 million people are Internally Displaced Persons (IDPS), out of which more than 80 percent are living in host communities and the rest in camps. 
“About 2.5 million Children are said to be malnourished, majority of them are in Adamawa, Borno and Yobe States. Also, about 1.3 million children are without access to education. Over 65,000 children are orphaned due to the crisis.”
